comments.commentBody: Are *now* being used? The GOP has been using the same argument, that President Obama isn't fulfilling his campaign promises, from the get go. For example, after continuously stonewalling the president for, say, *everything*, until the president bypasses the GOP in frustration, they then accuse Obama of breaking his promise of being non-partisan. The backstabbing GOP has spent the past four years preventing the Obama administration from accomplishing anything while arguing that the Obama administration is doing nothing. I'm astounded at the complacency and complicity of the press who continuously and unquestioningly parrot these accusations without the merest concern for veracity.
the treason part consists of setting out to cause the american government to fail. the senate minority leader was videotaped saying that he intends to do that.

What is reality is that when the Republicans tried to reform Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to deal with the overheated housing sector that Maxine Waters, Barney Frank, and Chris Dodd defeated the reform by manufacturing a reality that there was nothing wrong with the housing market.

There is a deliberate effort to set the stage before the main portion of public starts to pay attention. This stage is the fake reality that is being created to blame Obama for everything that happened last 3-4 years.

There 2 components to this manufactured reality.

1. Blame Obama for Bush's economy. This doesn't need to be explained.

2. Blame Obama for intransigent GOP Congress. With 2 conservative Dems and Sen Lieberman having constant issues with Dems, Obama never had supermajority and could never promote his agenda. Every legislation he proposed, including his ACA and Finacial Reform, had to be watered down in order to pass. All true job-creating bills, except for the Stimulus, never passed the Senate. The stimulus itself, watered down with tax cuts for the wealthy (a waste of money), was quickly deemed insufficient.

In effect, all the GOP efforts to throw the sand into struggling economy's gears, are being now used by GOP as Obama's creations. Lies combined with misinformation, all dressed up in a doomsday language of Obama's supposed utter incompetence, are used to make it more believable.

If this is not treason I don't know what treason is!

"The train has left the station." - Ed

Yes, but with few passengers except those in first class. The rest of the cars are just filled with baggage.

"plus the now avalanche of public figures endorsing Romney" - are you serious?  Do you mean the steady trickle of reluctant politicians who finally got behind him when there were no other candidates left?
Like any of these people had a choice. It is tough when you have to hold your nose to vote for your parties candidate by default.

Mitt Romney has done exceedingly well, with those that some have said, he could not win over, in the past primaries...evangelical Christians, tea party people, and some conservatives. Romney is connecting with people, despite political word that he can't connect.

The Republican primary was a serious challenge for Romney to succeed, considering the array of people against him, coupled with a media, looking for gottcha moments at every turn.

The general election will be an even playing field...President Obama versus Gov. Romney.

Considering what Romney went through in the primaries...plus the now avalanche of public figures endorsing Romney...the coming months will see the country responding to signs, of a new beginning in Washington, as Romney's bid for the White House picks up steam.

The train has left the station.

I am a firm believer in the short term memory loss and the ignorance of the American voter, therefore I believe this will be a close race regardless of Romney's outright lies and misleading statements. I also expect that, partially due to gerrymandering and voter ID laws Congess will fall back into Republican hands.
I knew in 2008 Obama inherited an economy that would not yield a significant rebound by 2012 and the continued economic mess would be blamed on him and the Democrats.
Polls show the race to be neck and neck, but one would think that based on the failure of 30 years of Republican economics this would not be the case.
All roads point to the failure of government at all levels during at least the past 8 years as the primary reason for our economic malaise, yet a significant number of Americans will again be asked to vote against their economic interests and will dutifully comply.
Amnesia seems to be a truly American affliction as does American apathy towards a police state seemed ingrained in our populace.
When I see a return of all the Republican, Personhood, legislations, to the democratic party and a significant filibuster proof democratic majority returned to the federal level of congress, only then will my disdain for the ignorant be eliminated.
What's the point of taking a country to court that doesn't abide by court decisions?

First, let me congratulate India in launching their Agni-v missile, which has an intended range of 5000 Km an immaculate and precise launch of the said missile, judos to the India team. Second, with varied mixed comments from all across the globe, people tend to forget that India as any other country has a right to live in peace, harmony and properity, but when can you achieve all of it, when you are strong enough to stand on your own feet, and when can you stand on your own feet when you are strong enough to do so, if not then this dog eat dog world would eat you, am I correct, therefore what has India done, is doing and will do is a logical and a rational step towards safe gaurding it self, its people, intergrity, respect, economy and borders from rouge and (mis)adventurous states, Third, the most important factor is that India is sandwiched between two nuclear arm states that do not have a good relationship with India, viz. Pakistan and China, both have had wars with India and both the states initiated the wars against India, now tell, what India did was right or wrong? Also China recently tried to flex its muscle on the eastern borders of India by pushing its armed force inside the line of defence so to provoke and play on India's psyche. China has been demading a chunk of an Indian state, Arunachal Pradesh for a long time, this a clear hegemonistic attitude by China after what happened in Tibet when Chinese forces overtook a peaceful country. Bravo India n keep it going!

This is the trouble with India's politics and its distorted model of democracy:  "good men" cannot survive because they do not bite and are not vindictive. They are seen as harmless by the "bad men" who form the majority of the people in power and who manipulate to pull the good people down. The "bad men" prosper in its politics because they cheat,  intimidate, even murder and bend the rules fearlessly. They are able to do this because they have been able to insulate themselves from effective prosecution and  convictions very subtly by framing appropriate rules which enables them to   wield a corrupting influence on the police, the investigating agencies and the judiciary.
Absolutely correct! There is no silver living in the power situation in India - at least none that sane people would be able to see!

Its only a "silver lining" for those who enjoy living without electricity.  If this were occurring in the U.S. no one would stand for it. Yet the writer feels compelled to stand up for (I assume) the little guy who would be oppressed by the big power plants and lament that they are so undereducated they couldnt get jobs at the plants any way.  It is a sad state of affairs and the people suffer because of it.  The lining is dark and bleak and far from silver.

So then what do you take away from the crime stories that you read in the NYTimes, Washington Post and Wall Street Journal? When you read about sexual abuse by Catholic priests, do you then assume that all Catholic priests are abusers?

When you read in the NY Times about burglaries, rapes, assaults made by white Christian men do you then assume that all white Christian men are criminals? And what do the crime stories you read tell you about African Americans?

Extremist Islamic terrorists are no more representative of Muslims than any of the other countless examples of white, black, Christian, or Jewish criminals are representative of their respective religious or ethnic groups.

Wow, the tail that wags the dog of american politics is telling us something we haven't heard already from our own right wing freaks. We should be so grateful that you schmekels are keeping the Palestinians down and away from our women.
it's not 4/20 any longer buddy

Mr sabapete, don't you and your very right wing group antagonize Palestinians for so many decades in every aspect of their lives? Stop talk nonsense from Israel because we have many right wing maniacs over here already, we certainly do not need any extra.

In another 4 years, should Obama be re-elected, he will blame his 8 years of failure of George Bush. He was elected on the platform of "change." That he did. He made things much worse. Obama will go down as perhaps the least competent President this US ever had. He has no grasp of economics. His foreign policy doesn't exist and he is an unbending, uncompromising politician. His smile, oratorical ability and media support all serve to hide an inexperienced, naive and inept leader. Even Sarah Palin had more experience and savvy after she was the mayor of an 8 person town.

It makes perfect sense. His point isn't about comfort; it's about the fact that in relation to the target user group for _mobile_ applications, the coders and designers at fb and ggle never really have to substantially interact with the mobile interface, and thus neglect it or ignore its relevance. Neither company was built around mobile applications or uses, and neither, despite their vast resources or previous history of innovations, is keeping up with the tiny operations who started with the  mobile platform.
Read our lips: George Bush's economic policies FAILED and will necessarily fail every time they're implemented.

Dave,  Do believe in the multiplier when it comes to Reagan or Bush- style tax cuts for the wealthy?  Reaganomics was Keynesian- why do conservatives accept one side of the argument  and not the other?

Dave Thomas

HNP asks a good question, where did you receive your economic training from other than maybe republican talking points.
And in case you have not noticed our defense industry is a great example of Keynesian economics of steroids, except for the fact that the Republicans never follow the second phase of Keynesian economics by raising revenue during the good times to pay for their profligate defense spending.

I wish Obama would get amnesia about the fictional Keynesian multiplier, the fantasy that self-sustaining jobs come from public sector growth instead of the private sector, or that government bureaucrats make better choices for the country than the collective wisdom of private individuals.

Hillary was wrong.

ALEC is the vast right-wing conspiracy.
Oh my !  GOP party is having a party with ALEC.  What happen to my vote and my tax dollars that pay you to represent me & we the people?

All the hand wringing and angst will change nothing, we the people are powerless.

Our President is a man with little political courage and will do little more than squeak.

The vintage of the 60's is long gone, and many of us lack the will or the energy to hobble back to the streets.

We are old, and only the youth of "Occupy can save us now, but we hate them...They make waves and break windows don't they? A2

The American Legislative Exchange Council (ALEC), in the opinion of many, has
over reached by manipulating Legislators throughout the States to pass Laws
ALEC favors for the advancement of its agenda. Following the dots in State after State that have passed new Voter ID Laws and Gun Laws all dots connect to ALEC. State and National Legislators took an Oath to Protect and Defend the Constitution of The United States against all Enemies both Foreign and Domestic. ALEC is not the Constitution.

To my fellow citizens - Welcome to the world of "Totally out of the loop"

Vote any way you like - The result is the same You lose. money wins.

At least there is a bright side. - I'll no longer have to part with the $50 political contribution I once thought would make a slight difference. Maybe I'll use that money to buy my way around the NYT firewall.
Steve B. - I'd love to give you your next glass of water.

The vast right wing conspiracy that Hillary Clinton talked about in the 90's has blossomed into this monstrosity of a takeover of our democratic society. No matter what this Seitz guy says, ALEC is a part of a sinister group of conservative organizations to increase power among the already too powerful at the cost of average Americans and their vote and their way of life. ALEC, Heritage Foundatiom, FreedomWorks and almost anything with a false patriotic sounding name is working against fairness in our country.

It is the evil genius of people like Karl Rove, Dick Armey, Dick and Liz Cheney and a host of others, and we count on journalists to bring these corrupt organizations into the light of day. You have done a terrible job and are very late in your reporting on this. Where are the the investigations?

While some dedicated representatives have been trying to work on legislation to help our country out of it's current problems, ALEC and others have been working full time on insidious, behind-closed-door-lobbying efforts to enrich and empower themselves as they obstruct legislation that will help the ecomony for all working classes of Americans and help the poor get a leg up into the lower middle class. They will destroy our country as we know it while manipulating the masses with demogoguery and division to distract us.

Many Americans are aware of this, please give us real choices in November and vote out anyone affiliated with ALEC.
ALEC is a 501(c)3 organization that is clearly lobbying in a partisan way.  They should be investigated by the IRS and their tax exempt status revoked!

While America is twittering about Brad and Angelina, democracy burns...just as the right wing wants it.  You can bet Fox News won't be reporting on this.  Thank you for a chilling and informative article.  But with no quick sound bite and at more than 300 characters, how many will be reading it?

The idea that this outfit could possibly be classified as a "public charity" is absurd and laughable. It's another example of how far out of whack our society is. I constantly debate in my mind whether people like this are truly evil and outrageously greedy and unconcerned about their fellow Americans, or whether they are self-deluded enough to think they're actually doing some good in what they have left of our society.

Why is the NYT writing this story now? It seems like the organization has been around for decades. It's hard to believe that NYT or other papers couldn't have obtained the documents that Common Cause got through FOIA or other means. It's great that the NYT is suddenly brining this to our attention (by the way ALEC's role was explored in a recent documentary called "Heist"), but I'm wondering what is prompting this and why it has never been covered before?

ALEC sounds like one heck of a Union to me, and its members are vigorous and rigorous, just as all Union Members should be.

As my social studies teacher in high school said (in 1952),"the Wall Street Journal is the best union newspaper in the country, but few recognize it as so".

Lobbying? What ALEC is doing is a form of corruption. These corporations are subverting democracy through use of 'legal' loopholes.

As a civic duty, I've long ago stopped shopping at Walmart, never use AT&T and try to avoid most Big Pharma products (Roche/Genentech is an exception).

A pro business, conservative organization promoting its position is a crime against humanity but where is the outcry against the ACLU, SEIU or any other liberal organization doing the same thing? ALEC is not casting any votes for legislation. Legislators vote. If they don't like the legislation, they don't have to vote for it.
